H0.text: The Earth rotating on its axis explains why daylight and darkness occur on Earth.

H1.text: The Sun rotates on its axis explains why daylight and darkness occur on Earth.

H2.text: The Earth's axis is tilted, which explains why daylight and darkness occur on Earth.

H3.text: The Earth revolves around the Sun explains why daylight and darkness occur on Earth.

A4.text: According to the 13th-century reference, 'the Earth is in constant circular motion, and what appears to be the motion of the heavens is actually due to the motion of the Earth and not the stars.'

A5.text: Aryabhata suggested that the apparent movement of the stars is a relative motion caused by the rotation of the Earth.
